div.l: Ye can by argumentes maken a place
A myle brode of tWenty fote of space
Let se now yf this place woll suffyse
Or make it romer with speche as is your gyse
¶ Now symond sayd this Iohn by saynt cuthberd
Ay is þᵘou mery and that is well answerd
I haue herd say men shal take of twa thȳnges
Swylk as he fyndes or swylk as he brynges
But specyally I pray the hoste so dere
Gete vs som mete ⁊and drynke ⁊and make vs chere
And we woll paye truely at the full
With empti hondes men may not hawkis tull
Lo here my syluer redy for to spende
¶ This myllar to þᵉ towne his doughter sende
For ale and brede and rostyd hem a goos
And bonde her hors he sholde nomore go loos
And in his owne chambre he made a bed
Wyth shetes and wyth chalons fayre y spred
Not from his owne bed ten fote or twelue
His doughter had a bed all by her selue
Ryght in the same chambre by and by
It myght be no bet and cause why
Ther was no romer herberow in the place
They suppen and speken hem of solace
And dronken ener stronge atte beste
Abowte mydnyghte went they to reste
¶ Wel hath this myllar vernysshed his hed
Full pale he was for dronke and not red
He yexith and he spekyth thorugh the nose
As he were in the quacke or in the pose
To bedde he goth ⁊and wyth hym goth his wyf
As ony Iay was she lyght and Iolyf
So was her Ioly whystyll well y wet
The cradyll at her beddys fete was fet
To rockyn and to geue the chylde sucke
And whan that dawkyn was in the crucke
To bedde wente the doughter ryght anone
To bedde goth aleyn and also Iohn
Ther nas nomore ther nedeth hem no dwale
This myllar hath so wysely bybbed ale
That as an hors he fnortyth and slepe
Ne of his tayll behynde he toke no kepe
His wyf bare hym a burden a full stronge
Men myghte her rowtynge here a furlonge
The wenche rowtyd eke per company
¶ Aleyn the clerke that herde this melody
He powkyd Iohn and sayd slepest thou
Herdest thou euer syke a songe or now
Lo whylke a cowplynge is a twene hem alle
A wylde fyre vpon her bodyes falle
Who herde euer syke a ferly thynge
Ye they shall haue the floure of yll endynge
This longe nyght ther tyd me ne reste
But yet ne force all shall be for the beste
For Iohn sayd aleyn also mot I thryue
Yf that I may yon wenche woll I swyue
Som esement hath lawe shapen vs
For Iohn ther is a lawe that sayth thus
That yf a man in o thynge be agreued
That in a nother he shall be releuyd
Our corn is stole sothly it is no naye
And we haue had an euyll fytte to daye
And syn I shall haue non amendement
Agayns my losse I woll haue esement
By goddys sale it shall non other be
¶ This Iohn answerde aleyn auyse the
The myllar is a perlous man he sayd
And yf that he out of his slepe brayd
He myght do vs bethe a vilonye
¶ Aleyn answerde I counte hym not a flye
And vp he rose and by the wenche he crept
This wenche laye vpryght and fast slept
Tyll he so ny was or she myght aspye
That it had be to late for to crye
And shortly for to telle they were attone
Now play aleyn for I woll speke of Iohn
¶ This Iohn lyeth styll a forlongway or two
And to hym self he made ruthe and wo
Alas qnod he this is a wycked Iape
Now maye I saye that I is but an ape
Yet hath my felowe somwhat for his harme
He hath the myllars doughter in his arme
He auntred hym and hath his nedes spedde
And I lye as a draf sak in my bedde
And whan this Iape is tolde a nother day
I shall be hold a daffe a cokenay
I woll aryse and auntre it by my fayth
Vnhardy is vnsely thus men sayth
¶ And vp he roos and softly he went
Vnto the cradyll and in his arm it hent
